Key to the families of Monocotyledons

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Xyridaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1994). Xyridaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence bracts glabrous throughout; female flower with perianth absent, and so ovary appearing to be distinctly shortly pedicellate; a very rare species
Inflorescence bracts of inner flowers distally with white hairs on abaxial surface; female flowers with 3 dark outer perianth lobes and 3 white inner perianth lobes; ovary sessile
